 11 -class ViewObjectBag(object): 

 12      """A managed collection of view objects.""" 

 13 -    def __init__(self, targets, viewerclass): 

 14          """Initialise a ViewObjectBag, with a given collection of model objects 
 15          and a class of view object. 
 16           
 17          :Parameters: 
 18              `targets` : iterable 
 19                  An iterable of model objects which are to be handled. 
 20              `viewerclass` : class 
 21                  The class of view object with which to handle the model objects. 
 22          """ 
 23           
 24          self.targets = targets 
 25          self.viewers = dict()  
 26          self.viewerclass = viewerclass 

 27       

 28 -    def report(self): 

 29          """Return a string describing the contents of a ViewObjectBag""" 
 30          return "%s: %d" % (self.viewerclass.__name__, len(self.viewers)) 

 31           

 32 -    def tick(self): 

 33          """Update the list of view objects, creating and destroying objects as 
 34          necessary. Tick each of the view objects within the bag.""" 
 35           
 36          for target in self.targets: 
 37              if target not in self.viewers: 
 38                  self.viewers[target] = self.viewerclass(target) 
 39          for target, viewer in self.viewers.items(): 
 40              viewer.tick() 
 41              if viewer.dead: 
 42                  del self.viewers[target] 

 43   

 44 -    def draw(self): 

 45          """Render each of the included view items""" 
 46          for viewer in self.viewers.values(): 
 47              viewer.draw()

163 -class ParticleSystem(object): 

164      """A system of point particles.""" 
165       

166 -    def __init__(self, particle_class=Particle, slots=64): 

167          """Initialise a particle system. 
168           
169          :Parameters: 
170              `particle_class` : class 
171                  The subclass of Particle to use for this system. 
172              `slots` : int 
173                  The initial number of slots to allocate for particles. Defaults 
174                  to 64. 
175          """ 
176           
177          self.num_slots = slots 
178          self.data = (gl.GLfloat * (slots * 10))() 
179          self.available_slots = range(slots) 
180          self.dirty_indices = True 
181          self.live_particles = [] 
182          self.particle_class = particle_class 

183   

184 -    def new_particle(self, *args, **kwargs): 

185          """Add a new particle to the system. Any arguments are passed to the  
186          particle constructor.""" 
187           
188          if not self.available_slots: 
189              self._expand() 
190          p = self.particle_class(self, self.available_slots.pop(), *args, **kwargs) 
191          self.live_particles.append(p) 
192          self.dirty_indices = True 

193   

194 -    def delete_particle(self, particle): 

195          """Remove a particle from the system. 
196           
197              :Parameters: 
198                  `particle` : Particle 
199                      The particle to be removed. 
200          """ 
201          self.live_particles.remove(particle) 
202          self.available_slots.append(particle.slot) 
203          self.dirty_indices = True 

204   

205 -    def _expand(self): 

206          self.available_slots.extend(range(self.num_slots, self.num_slots*2)) 
207          self.num_slots *= 2 
208          self.data = (gl.GLfloat * (self.num_slots * 10))(*self.data) 

209   

210 -    def draw(self): 

211          """Render the particle system.""" 
212           
213          if not self.live_particles: 
214              return 
215          if self.dirty_indices: 
216              indices = [p.slot for p in self.live_particles if not p.dead] 
217              self.indices = (gl.GLuint * len(indices))(*indices) 
218              self.dirty_indices = False 
219          gl.glPointSize(self.particle_class.size) 
220          gl.glInterleavedArrays(gl.GL_C4F_N3F_V3F, 0, self.data) 
221          gl.glDrawElements(gl.GL_POINTS, len(self.indices), gl.GL_UNSIGNED_INT, self.indices) 

222   

223 -    def tick(self): 

224          """Update the particle system.""" 
225          deadlist = [] 
226          for p in self.live_particles[:]: 
227              p.tick() 
228              if p.dead: 
229                  self.delete_particle(p)

239 -class DisplayList(object): 

240      """A wrapper class for GL display lists. When called, renders its contents. 
241      """ 
242       

243 -    def __init__(self): 

244          """Create a new display list""" 
245          self.id = gl.glGenLists(1) 

246       

247 -    def begin(self): 

248          """Begin compilation of a display list.""" 
249          gl.glNewList(self.id, gl.GL_COMPILE) 

250       

251 -    def end(self): 

252          """End compilation of a display list.""" 
253          gl.glEndList() 

254       

255 -    def __call__(self): 

256          gl.glCallList(self.id) 

257           

258 -    def __del__(self): 

259          if gl.gl_info.have_context(): 
260              try: 
261                  gl.glDeleteLists(self.id, 1) 
262              except:

267 -def gl_compiled_function(func): 

268      """Function decorator which thunks function calls as GL display lists. Be 
269      warned that these are never freed.""" 
270      disp_lists = dict() 
271      def compiled_func(*args, **kwargs): 
272          argtuple = (args, tuple(kwargs.items())) 
273          if argtuple not in disp_lists: 
274              lst = DisplayList() 
275              lst.begin() 
276              func(*args, **kwargs) 
277              lst.end() 
278              disp_lists[argtuple] = lst 
279          disp_lists[argtuple]() 
280          if len(disp_lists) > 1000: 
281              print "Warning, %s recompiled too often [%s, %s]" % (func, args, kwargs) 

282   
283      return compiled_func 
284   

285 -def gl_compiled_method(func): 

286      """Method decorator which thunks method calls as GL display lists. These are 
287      freed upon garbage collection of the relevant object instance.""" 
288      def compiled_method(self, *args, **kwargs): 
289          if not hasattr(self, "compiled_disp_lists"): 
290              self.compiled_disp_lists = dict() 
291          argtuple = (args, tuple(kwargs.items())) 
292          if argtuple not in self.compiled_disp_lists: 
293              lst = DisplayList() 
294              lst.begin() 
295              func(self, *args, **kwargs) 
296              lst.end() 
297              self.compiled_disp_lists[argtuple] = lst 
298          self.compiled_disp_lists[argtuple]() 
299          if len(self.compiled_disp_lists) > 1000: 
300              print "Warning, %s recompiled too often [%s, %s]" % (func, args, kwargs) 

301      return compiled_method 
302       

303 -def motion_blur(func): 

304      """Function decorator implementing a motion blur post-processing effect. To 
305      be applied to the main rendering function.""" 
306      texes = [] 
307      num_texes = 10 
308      buffers = [] 
309      def multi_draw(*args, **kwargs): 
310          gl.glEnable(gl.GL_BLEND) 
311          gl.glBlendFunc(gl.GL_ONE, gl.GL_ONE) 
312          gl.glEnable(gl.GL_LINE_SMOOTH) 
313          gl.glEnable(gl.GL_POINT_SMOOTH) 
314          gl.glClearColor(0, 0, 0, 0) 
315          gl.glColor4f(1,1,1,1) 
316       
317          gl.glClear(gl.GL_COLOR_BUFFER_BIT) 
318   
319          if not buffers: 
320              buffers.append(image.get_buffer_manager()) 
321          x, y, w, h = buffers[0].get_viewport() 
322   
323          #Draw lowres version 
324          gl.glViewport(0,0,256,256) 
325          func(*args, **kwargs) 
326          texes.append(buffers[0].get_color_buffer().texture) 
327          if len(texes) > num_texes: 
328              texes.pop(0) 
329               
330          #Lay down copies of lowres version 
331          gl.glViewport(x,y,w,h) 
332          gl.glClear(gl.GL_COLOR_BUFFER_BIT) 
333          if texes: 
334              alphas = range(1,len(texes)+1) 
335              alphas = [float(f)/sum(alphas) for f in alphas] 
336              for tex, alpha in zip(texes, alphas): 
337                  gl.glBindTexture(tex.target, tex.id) 
338               
339                  gl.glEnable(gl.GL_TEXTURE_2D) 
340                  gl.glTexParameteri(gl.GL_TEXTURE_2D, gl.GL_TEXTURE_MAG_FILTER, gl.GL_LINEAR) 
341                   
342                  gl.glColor4f(1,1,1,alpha) 
343                  gl.glBegin(gl.GL_QUADS) 
344                  gl.glTexCoord2f(0,0) 
345                  gl.glVertex3f(0,0,-.5) 
346                  gl.glTexCoord2f(1,0) 
347                  gl.glVertex3f(w,0,-.5) 
348                  gl.glTexCoord2f(1,1) 
349                  gl.glVertex3f(w,h,-.5) 
350                  gl.glTexCoord2f(0,1) 
351                  gl.glVertex3f(0,h,-.5) 
352                  gl.glEnd() 
353                  gl.glDisable(gl.GL_TEXTURE_2D) 
354               
355          #Draw real thing 
356          gl.glColor4f(1,1,1,1) 
357          func(*args, **kwargs) 

358      return multi_draw 
359      

360 -def vector_glow(func): 

361      """Function decorator implementing a 'vector glow' post-processing effect. 
362      To be applied to the main rendering function.""" 
363       
364      disp_list = [] 
365      buffers = [] 
366      ctex = [None] 
367   
368      def multi_draw(*args, **kwargs): 
369          gl.glEnable(gl.GL_BLEND) 
370          gl.glBlendFunc(gl.GL_ONE, gl.GL_ONE) 
371          gl.glEnable(gl.GL_LINE_SMOOTH) 
372          gl.glEnable(gl.GL_POINT_SMOOTH) 
373          gl.glClearColor(0, 0, 0, 0) 
374          gl.glColor4f(1,1,1,1) 
375       
376          gl.glClear(gl.GL_COLOR_BUFFER_BIT) 
377   
378          if not buffers: 
379              buffers.append(image.get_buffer_manager()) 
380          x, y, w, h = buffers[0].get_viewport() 
381   
382          #Draw lowres version 
383          gl.glViewport(0,0,256,256) 
384          func(*args, **kwargs) 
385          ctex[0] = buffers[0].get_color_buffer().texture 
386   
387          #Lay down copies of lowres version 
388          gl.glViewport(x,y,w,h) 
389          gl.glClear(gl.GL_COLOR_BUFFER_BIT) 
390          gl.glBindTexture(ctex[0].target, ctex[0].id) 
391          gl.glEnable(gl.GL_TEXTURE_2D) 
392          gl.glTexParameteri(gl.GL_TEXTURE_2D, gl.GL_TEXTURE_MAG_FILTER, gl.GL_LINEAR) 
393          if not disp_list: 
394              disp_list.append(gl.glGenLists(1)) 
395              gl.glNewList(disp_list[0], gl.GL_COMPILE) 
396              for u in range(-3,4,3): 
397                  for v in range(-3,4,3): 
398                      gl.glColor4f(1,1,1,(20.0 - u **2 - v ** 2) / 72) 
399                      gl.glBegin(gl.GL_QUADS) 
400                      gl.glTexCoord2f(0,0) 
401                      gl.glVertex3f(u,v,-.5) 
402                      gl.glTexCoord2f(1,0) 
403                      gl.glVertex3f(u+w,v,-.5) 
404                      gl.glTexCoord2f(1,1) 
405                      gl.glVertex3f(u+w,v+h,-.5) 
406                      gl.glTexCoord2f(0,1) 
407                      gl.glVertex3f(u,v+h,-.5) 
408                      gl.glEnd() 
409              gl.glEndList() 
410          gl.glCallList(disp_list[0]) 
411          gl.glDisable(gl.GL_TEXTURE_2D) 
412   
413          #Draw real thing 
414          gl.glColor4f(1,1,1,1) 
415          func(*args, **kwargs) 

416   
417      return multi_draw
